CatDescriptText: Pinkie White, retired worker, 2128 Festus Way, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1959, pg. 32 with question: "Do you believe in capital punishment? If so, do you  think that it should be imposed on convicted defendants under the age of 21?" answer reads: "No, I don't.  I know that it is wrong to kill.  But because you kill me, I don't want somebody to kill you.  YOu may have a chance to recover and become a good person."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Pinkie White wearing light colored head scarf, and dark coat with brooch on left lapel, standing on Smithfield Street with Brass Rail Restaurant in background, Downtown
